page.title: 01BURWASH VILLAGE
page.content: Burwash is a pretty little village set high on a ridge between the River Rother on the North side and the River Dudwell on the South. The population is approimately 2000 people. By a fourtunate quirk of history, the railway which was planned to run through Burwash never materialized. The nearest trains now stop at Etchingham and Stonegate - each about three miles away. Thus access to London and some of the larger towns in the South-East is made quite easy. Consequently, a considerable number of working inhabitants of the village commute to work each day by train.
